arxiv.org.reason: Preprint server for academic research, peer review not guaranteed but high quality

acm.org.reason: Association for Computing Machinery, peer-reviewed publications

scholar.google.com.reason: Academic search engine, quality varies by source

researchgate.net.reason: Academic social network, mix of peer-reviewed and preprints

nih.gov.reason: US National Institutes of Health, authoritative medical source

cdc.gov.reason: US Centers for Disease Control, authoritative health source

who.int.reason: World Health Organization, international health authority

nist.gov.reason: US National Institute of Standards and Technology

nasa.gov.reason: US space agency, authoritative for space and earth sciences

reuters.com.reason: Major international news agency, fact-based reporting

bbc.com.reason: British Broadcasting Corporation, established news organization

nytimes.com.reason: Major US newspaper, news and opinion sections differ in reliability

wsj.com.reason: Wall Street Journal, strong for business/finance news

techcrunch.com.reason: Technology news site, good for industry news

hbr.org.reason: Harvard Business Review, business and management research

wikipedia.org.reason: Crowdsourced encyclopedia, good for overviews but verify primary sources

stackoverflow.com.reason: Community Q&A for programming, quality varies by answer votes

developer.mozilla.org.reason: Mozilla Developer Network, authoritative web documentation

reddit.com.reason: Social platform, highly variable quality, verify claims elsewhere

twitter.com.reason: Social media, unverified claims common, use for primary sources only

x.com.reason: Social media (formerly Twitter), unverified claims common

medium.com.reason: Blogging platform, quality depends entirely on author

substack.com.reason: Newsletter platform, quality depends on author credentials

quora.com.reason: Q&A platform, answers vary widely in quality

linkedin.com.reason: Professional network, posts are opinion not fact-checked

forbes.com.reason: Mix of staff and contributor content, quality varies

metadata.description: Initial credibility scores for common sources in research-loop

scoring_guide.80-89: Very reliable - established institutions, major outlets
scoring_guide.70-79: Generally reliable - quality publications, some caveats
scoring_guide.50-69: Mixed reliability - depends on specific content/author
scoring_guide.0-29: Unreliable - known misinformation, satire, or spam
